modified:
The party hereinafter referred to as "Assignee," formerly known as Sorrent, Inc. ("Original Licensor").

In this revised clause, the term "Licensee" has been replaced with "Assignee", signifying that a new entity is now responsible for the license, rather than the original party (Sorrent, Inc.). This change subtly shifts the responsibility from one party to another while maintaining professionalism and clarity.

original: (i) “ICE AGE 2” WIRELESS  PRODUCTS:  Licensee shall develop and distribute the  following Wireless Products in connection with the property  “ICE AGE 2”: (i) 1 Java Game;  (ii) 1 Java Application (‘Screensaver’)  where feasible; (iii) up to 5 MMS; (iv) up to  10 Wallpapers; (v) and up to 5 Voicetones (“ICE  AGE 2 Wireless Products”) in each of the following five (5)  languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, with  Portuguese, Greek, Dutch and Swedish to be made available where  practicable. Licensee shall have the non-exclusive right and  license to develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products  during the Term of the Agreement for all Wireless Products set  forth in this Paragraph 2(c) except the Game, for which  Licensee shall have the exclusive right and license to develop  and distribute until December 31, 2006. For the avoidance of  doubt, Licensee’s right and license to develop and  distribute the Game in connection with the Property “ICE  AGE 2” shall become non-exclusive after December 31,  2006.
modified:
"(ii) 'ICE AGE 2' WIRELESS PRODUCTS DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION: Licensor grants Licensee a non-exclusive right and license to create and distribute the following Wireless Products in conjunction with the property "ICE AGE 2": (i) 1 Java Game; (ii) 1 Java Application (‘Screensaver’), if technically viable; (iii) up to 5 MMS; (iv) up to 10 Wallpapers; (v) and up to 5 Voicetones ("ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products") in the following five (5) languages: English, French, German, Italian, Spanish. Portuguese, Greek, Dutch, and Swedish may be offered where practical. During the term of the agreement, Licensee can develop and distribute ICE AGE 2 Wireless Products for all Wireless Products specified in this Paragraph 2(c), except the Game, for which Licensee will have exclusive rights until December 31, 2006. From January 1, 2007, onwards, the license to develop and distribute the Game associated with the Property "ICE AGE 2" becomes non-exclusive."

Changes made:
- Changed from Licensor granting Licensee exclusive rights for developing and distributing the Game until December 31, 2006 to giving them non-exclusive rights after that date. This makes it clearer that the Licensor no longer has an exclusive hold on the Game development and distribution after a specific date.
- Clarified that Portuguese, Greek, Dutch, and Swedish may be offered where practicable, rather than stating they will be made available without qualification.

original: (A) “ICE AGE 2” RESERVATION OF  RIGHTS:  Fox hereby reserves the right to develop,  publish and/or distribute (or grant a third party the right to  develop, publish, and/or distribute) any wireless products or  wireless content or any nature which may be derived from the  property “ICE AGE 2”. Notwithstanding  the foregoing,  in no event will Fox develop, publish and/or distribute games  derived from the Property “ICE AGE 2” prior to  January 1, 2007.
ollama_generated: (B) "ICE AGE 2" EXPLICIT PERMISSION REQUIRED FOR DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION: By entering into this agreement, the Party acknowledges that Fox retains exclusive rights to develop, publish, and distribute (or license a third party for such activities) any wireless products or content inspired by the intellectual property "ICE AGE 2". Any interested party may initiate such activities post January 1, 2007, only with the express written consent of Fox prior to commencement.

The Guarantee Forfeiture Payment may  be recouped from Licensee’s sales of the IN HER SHOES  Wireless Product and the IDIOCRACY Wireless Product, as set  forth in Paragraphs 2(a)(ii) and 2(b)(i) of this Amendment. Clause:

Origin: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007 (US$*****), and Fox shall have the option to receive, at its discretion, a Guarantee Forfeiture Payment of ***** dollars (US$*****) from the Licensee, equivalent to a total potential Guarantee payment by Fox of ***** dollars (US$*****). If Fox exercises this option, the Guarantee Forfeiture Payment may be recouped from the Licensee's sales of the IN HER SHOES Wireless Product and the IDIOCRACY Wireless Product, as outlined in Paragraphs 2(a)(ii) and 2(b)(i) of this Amendment. Moreover, according to Paragraph 2(c)(ii) of this Amendment, Fox may require an additional minimum guarantee from the Licensee, amounting to ***** dollars (US$*****), which can be recouped under the terms of this agreement.

In this revised clause, the obligation has been shifted from the Licensor to the Fox, and the condition for the payment has been changed from mandatory to optional at Fox's discretion. The new clause also emphasizes that Fox may require additional minimum guarantees from the Licensee.

original: 5. MUTUTAL  RELEASE : With the exception of  Licensee’s Royalties payment obligations with respect to  all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment,  and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party  shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all  claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
ollama_generated:
5. CONTINUING OBLIGATIONS AND WAIVER OF FUTURE CLAIMS : Except for the Licensee's Royalties payment obligations regarding all Wireless Products launched up to the date of this Amendment, and the provisions detailed in this Amendment, both parties will continue to fulfill their existing obligations under the Agreement. However, any future claims arising from the Agreement will be waived by both parties, except for those claims related to the aforementioned Royalties payment obligations.

This revised clause maintains a professional tone but slightly modifies the original clause by stating that both parties will continue their existing obligations rather than releasing each other from any further obligations. Additionally, it clarifies that future claims can still be made for the Royalty payment obligations.

original: ***** The omitted portions of this exhibit have been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to a request for confidential treatment under Rule 406 promulgated under the Securities Act of 1933.
